scone.window



struct Window;


this(uint width, uint height);
initializes the window.

NOTE:
should only be used once. use 
size(w,h);
to resize

void write(Args...)(in uint x, in uint y, Args args);
Write practically anything to the window

Example:
window.write(3, 5, "hello ", fg(Color.green)'w', Cell('o', fg(Color.red)), "rld ", 42, [1337, 1001, 1]);


NOTE:
Does not directly write to the window, changes will only be visible after 
window.print();


void print();
Displays what has been written

void clear();
Clear the screen, making it ready for the next 
print();


void flush();
Causes next 
print()
to write out all cells.

NOTE:
Only use this if some sort of visual bug occurs.

@property void title(string title);
Set the size of the window

@property void cursorVisible(bool visible);
Set if the cursor should be visible

void resize(uint width, uint height);
Changes the size of the window

Note:
Clears the window

uint width();
Get the width of the window

uint height();
Get the height of the window

alias w = width;


alias h = height;


InputEvent[] getInputs();
Returns:
InputEvent

struct Cell;


char character;
character

fg foreground;
foreground color

bg background;
background color

Cell[] cellString(string str, Color color, Color background);
Create an array of cells with foreground- and background color

Returns:
Cell[]
